text:
<@U026E0ZNR> <@U0MKH0BE0> <@U02AUNA0P> Type changes for spec! Depending on where you were looking, a few header numbers have changed. If you were referencing the annotated print out:
- H6 is gone, replaced with H4
- H8 is gone, replaced by P1
- H7 is now H6
- H9 is now H8

If you were looking at the original guide from 07/20:
- H7 is gone, replaced by P1
- And H7 is a new style
Let me know if you have any questions
The guide above is correct then

<@U1A1A9L7N> I have updated button values for you. All buttons with fills appear to have a vertical gradient starting lighter at top and shifting to the core colors that we have already in the style guide.

Primary Button: 
#FD987B
to
#FF8D6D

Primary Button Pressed:
#D08467
to
#CC7756

Primary Button Inactive:
#D9DADA
to
#D7D7D7
Thanks <@U026E0ZNR>
Yep! Sorry it slipped my mind until this morning
No worries
will I mess up anybody’s process if I go through the comp share folder, and rename the pngs with the screen number + name?
Since there are no objections yet, I’ll start this. I’ll keep a copy of the original file names in case we need to revert.
thanks megan
no objections from me
thanks <@U0HP6TFNX>
:thumbsup:
<@U0HP6TFNX> let me know when the file names are updated so i can change the ones for my spec/comps too (no rush at all too btw!)
<@U02AUNA0P>: k, I finished the onboarding section, working on profile now
<@U0HP6TFNX>: I’m going to be re-uploading my comps for profile and settings, so I can change the names on dropbox as I go
sounds good <@U0XCJ372R> - do you have what you need for the screen numbers? I made sure everything was up to speed in the wireframe pngs exported from sketch. Is that enough for you to go off of?
Yes! And it looks like you got most of the profile done in the dropbox, so thank you!
no problem. the files that are prefixed with “9.” are the ones that have been updated so far
Perfect! Thank you

<@U026E0ZNR>: <@U0XCJ372R> <@U02AUNA0P> <@U0MKH0BE0> -here is the file path where you can put your working files. If we could please have these uploaded by tomorrow EOD that would be best. <https://www.dropbox.com/home/Compass%20-%20working%20files/Visual%20Design/Working%20Files>

attachments.fallback: [August 1st, 2016 3:28 PM] jenna.simon: <@U026E0ZNR>: <@U0XCJ372R> <@U02AUNA0P> <@U0MKH0BE0> -here is the file path where you can put your working files. If we could please have these uploaded by tomorrow EOD that would be best. <https://www.dropbox.com/home/Compass%20-%20working%20files/Visual%20Design/Working%20Files>
attachments.text: <@U026E0ZNR>: <@U0XCJ372R> <@U02AUNA0P> <@U0MKH0BE0> -here is the file path where you can put your working files. If we could please have these uploaded by tomorrow EOD that would be best. <https://www.dropbox.com/home/Compass%20-%20working%20files/Visual%20Design/Working%20Files>

text: <@U0U9WJB7F|jenna.simon> pinned a message to this channel.
Thanks Jenna. Are we wanting to upload just our recent/most up to date working files or do we want the tons of progress files from throughout the current design direction too?
I think the most up to date files is just fine!
Great, thanks!
Thanks Jenna! please upload your files as soon as you can. I am going to pull down copies and use them to document character limits in my content audit. Thank youuuuu :slightly_smiling_face:
mine are uploaded
awesome
<@U0U9WJB7F>: For some reason when I follow the link I get an error that it doesn’t exist.
that happens sometimes-I’ll delete you and readd
one moment!
try again!

<@U026E0ZNR>: <@U0XCJ372R> <@U0MKH0BE0> <@U02AUNA0P> <@U1A1A9L7N>  just a reminder that I’ll be sending the Global Spec document (for Android & iOS) + links to dropbox where devs can access comps and key screens for iOS and Android so please make sure you’re all updated before you leave today and if you have a blocker definitely let me know so we can make a plan :slightly_smiling_face:
sorry to beat a dead horse, I’m sure you’re all sick of me saying the same thing!!
I’m just finishing the global spec
nice!
once we upload specs to dropbox, do we have a system to notify of updated spec comps? even if we’re “done” today i suspect there’ll be inevitable changes later on
Yeah there will definitely be changes and we haven’t figured out how to address those changes
it’s on the list
:slightly_smiling_face:
Maybe as we move forward we can continue to use the “Pending” label when things are in process

EOD Update:
- I updated my IOS Specs from the changes on Friday
- I finished my Android Specs & created a global list spec for Android
- Went through my Comps on dropbox and and made sure they were up to date and properly named
- Uploaded IOS and Android Key Screen Specs to Dropbox

Tomorrow I will put all my working files on dropbox.

<@U1A1A9L7N> I guess the scenario I’m trying to plan for is when we assume something is finished, devs start working off of that, and then we realize there was something we missed. How can we set it up so we don’t need to hunt down devs using “old” spec comps for this situation? Even though we’re already attaching the wireframe codes to comp files, I was thinking about the date-in-the-file-name approach. Opinions on that?
Yes, typically using the date on the file or the packaged folder works best
<@U026E0ZNR> date your files and also put your initials in the filename. The naming convention we’ve been using for UX can be seen here:
<@U0260V1BX|melissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F1X63UGJX/screen_shot_2016-08-01_at_5.11.49_pm.png|Screen Shot 2016-08-01 at 5.11.49 PM.png>
YYYY MM DD HH MM Section_Initials
and update the feature team channel when you’ve uploaded a new file
that way everyone knows there’s an update
its a lot of numbers but it’s helpful when you’re making multiple updates a day. not sure if that will be the case for visuals :slightly_smiling_face:
ex: _2016 08 01 12 30 5.6.3 Library Dx BB-Level 2 Content_TEE.png_ ?
ohhh the screen numbers
shit
5.6.3 Library Dx BB-Level 2 Content_ 2016 08 01 12 30 TEE.png might work better
Ok we can definitely do that if it seems most clear

Can we make a call for the whole team to get behind? I know we’re peacing out for the day and don’t imagine file name changing happening tonight, but just want us to have a good solution before it gets difficult to change.

EOD Update:
• finished up Android specs 
• uploaded specs (iOS & Android) to dropbox and the google drive
• uploaded working files to dropbox
• uploaded comp updates to dropbox and the google drive

yeah, i’d love to get a sense from you guys on how many updates you’re seeing. The HH MM bit might be totally unnecessary if updates are only happening every couple days. Definitely don't want these file names to be unnecessarily long
the HH MM seems maybe a bit excessive
i’ve been using YYMMDD for all my folders/psds and append (2) or (3) if i really need multiple versions in a day
i don’t see that happening at this point though
that sounds fine. so in that scenario the file would be 5.6.3 Library Dx BB-Level 2 Content_160801_TEE.png?
yup, if screen flow progression is priority then that is perfect (which i assume it is the priority, over date of revision)
ok everyone that read that convo, nevermind on renaming individual files. we’ll take care of any time stamping on a folder based level to avoid renaming so many things with the same info :innocent:
good call.
:raised_hands: :pray: :raised_hands: :pray:

<@U0U9WJB7F> i’ve uploaded my specs to Dropbox in the appropriate folder. i noticed one thing we’ll need to change in the morning, i needed to do a slight layout change on the dots representing progress on Dx headers. so <@U0XCJ372R> ’s android spec’ing for this needs to be updated real quick (I just realized I hadn’t relayed the info to her)
file _5.6.7.1 Library Dx BB-Manual Session Marking.png_ for reference
all good thank you <@U026E0ZNR>
